name: Mark of the Ninja
summary: Mark of the Ninja is a side-scrolling action stealth video game developed by Klei Entertainment and published by Microsoft Studios. It was announced on February 28, 2012 and later released for the Xbox 360 via Xbox Live Arcade on September 7, 2012. A Microsoft Windows version was released on October 16, 2012. It follows the story of a nameless ninja in the present day, and features a themed conflict between ancient ninja tradition and modern technology. Cutscenes for the game are rendered in Saturday morning cartoon animation style.

esrb.synopsis: This is an action game in which players assume the role of a ninja seeking revenge on behalf of his clan. As players traverse through side-scrolling levels, they use various ninja weapons (e.g., swords, shuriken, darts, spiked mines) to kill human soldiers in hand-to-hand combat; some attacks trigger zoomed-in camera angles, and slashing/gushing sounds can be heard as enemies are stabbed or impaled. Stealth is a primary game mechanic, and players can execute various attack moves to avoid detection (e.g., descending from above to slice enemies' throats). Though combat and cutscenes are stylized and cartoonlike, kills are accompanied by exaggerated splashes of bright red blood. Cut scenes also depict acts of violence: a guard getting chopped in half; a villain impaling himself with a sword as blood pools underneath him. The words “f**k” and “sh*t” appear in the dialogue.
